newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - May 14.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - May 14.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on May 14. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Thirty-three year-old Harnoko Dewantono, alias Oki, has been sentenced to death for the murder of his Indian business partner, his younger brother and Indonesian school friend in Los Angeles in the early 1990s.

Leaders of the Moslem-oriented United Development Party (PPP) said that government moves to ban posters and banners carrying "Mega-Bintang" slogans were signs of political jealousy. Mega-Bintang is the name under which supporters of ousted Indonesian Democratic Party (PDI) leader Megawati Sukarnoputri have rallied in an apparent alliance with PPP supporters.
President Suharto has ordered election organisers to reprimand the leaders of the three authorised political parties for increasing violence in the election campaign.
The election campaign events of the government-backed faction of the Indonesian Democratic Party (PDI) were marked by lacklustre campaigning and poor attendances on Tuesday.
